title: annotation_service
description: A pipeline to process and annotate gene expression data.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: The output file to write the annotated dataset to.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The output file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The output file.

query input.title: Query input
query input.description: The input query dataset(s) to be annotated

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Input query dataset(s) to be annotated
input.help_text: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Input query dataset(s) to be annotated

query input specifications.title: Query input specifications
query input specifications.description: Specifications of vars, obs and layers of the input query dataset(s) h5mu files

query_rna_layer.description: Type: `string`. Input layer for the gene expression modality of the query datasets
query_rna_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Input layer for the gene expression modality of the query datasets. If not specified, .X is used.

var_query_gene_names.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata var column containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used
var_query_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata var column containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used.

obs_query_batch.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata obs column containing the batch labels
obs_query_batch.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata obs column containing the batch labels.

reference input.title: Reference input
reference input.description: The reference dataset to be used as a reference mapper and to train annotation algorithms on.

reference.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `https://zenodo.org/records/7587774/files/TS_Lung_filtered.h5ad`. The reference dataset to be used as a reference mapper and to train annotation algorithms on
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `https://zenodo.org/records/7587774/files/TS_Lung_filtered.h5ad`. The reference dataset to be used as a reference mapper and to train annotation algorithms on.

reference input specifications.title: Reference input specifications
reference input specifications.description: Specifications of vars, obs and layers of the reference dataset h5 file

obs_reference_batch.help_text: Type: `string`, required. The .obs column of the reference dataset containing the batch information.

reference_rna_layer.description: Type: `string`. Input layer for the gene expression modality of the reference dataset
reference_rna_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Input layer for the gene expression modality of the reference dataset. If not specified, .X is used.

obs_reference_targets.description: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `ann_level_1:ann_level_2:ann_level_3:ann_level_4:ann_level_5:ann_finest_level`, multiple_sep: `":"`. The `
obs_reference_targets.help_text: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `ann_level_1:ann_level_2:ann_level_3:ann_level_4:ann_level_5:ann_finest_level`, multiple_sep: `":"`. The `.obs` key(s) of the target labels to tranfer.

annotation methods.title: Annotation methods
annotation methods.description: The available annotation methods to annotate the query dataset(s) with.

annotation_methods.description: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `harmony_knn`, multiple_sep: `":"`, choices: ``harmony_knn`, `scgpt_annotation``.
annotation_methods.help_text: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `harmony_knn`, multiple_sep: `":"`, choices: ``harmony_knn`, `scgpt_annotation``.

scgpt model input.title: scGPT model input
scgpt model input.description: scGPT model input, required for scGPT annotation methods

model.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. The model file containing checkpoints and cell type label mapper
model.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. The model file containing checkpoints and cell type label mapper.

model_config.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. The model configuration file
model_config.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. The model configuration file.

model_vocab.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Model vocabulary file directory
model_vocab.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Model vocabulary file directory.

finetuned_checkpoints_key.description: Type: `string`, default: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model  file containing the pretrained checkpoints
finetuned_checkpoints_key.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model  file containing the pretrained checkpoints.

label_mapper_key.description: Type: `string`, default: `id_to_class`. Key in the model file containing the cell type class to label mapper dictionary
label_mapper_key.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `id_to_class`. Key in the model file containing the cell type class to label mapper dictionary.

pre-processing options: rna filtering.title: Pre-processing options: RNA filtering
pre-processing options: rna filtering.description: Pre-processing options for filtering RNA data

rna_min_counts.description: Type: `integer`, example: `200`. Minimum number of counts captured per cell
rna_min_counts.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `200`. Minimum number of counts captured per cell.

rna_max_counts.description: Type: `integer`, example: `5000000`. Maximum number of counts captured per cell
rna_max_counts.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `5000000`. Maximum number of counts captured per cell.

rna_min_genes_per_cell.description: Type: `integer`, example: `200`. Minimum of non-zero values per cell
rna_min_genes_per_cell.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `200`. Minimum of non-zero values per cell.

rna_max_genes_per_cell.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1500000`. Maximum of non-zero values per cell
rna_max_genes_per_cell.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1500000`. Maximum of non-zero values per cell.

rna_min_cells_per_gene.description: Type: `integer`, example: `3`. Minimum of non-zero values per gene
rna_min_cells_per_gene.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `3`. Minimum of non-zero values per gene.

rna_min_fraction_mito.description: Type: `double`, example: `0`. Minimum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial
rna_min_fraction_mito.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0`. Minimum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial.

rna_max_fraction_mito.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.2`. Maximum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial
rna_max_fraction_mito.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.2`. Maximum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial.

pre-processing options: highly variable.title: Pre-processing options: Highly variable features detection
pre-processing options: highly variable.description: Pre-processing options for detecting highly variable features

highly_variable_features_var_output.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `filter_with_hvg`. In which .var slot to store a boolean array corresponding to the highly variable genes.

highly_variable_features_obs_batch_key.description: Type: `string`, default: `sample_id`. If specified, highly-variable genes are selected within each batch separately and merged
highly_variable_features_obs_batch_key.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `sample_id`. If specified, highly-variable genes are selected within each batch separately and merged. This simple 
process avoids the selection of batch-specific genes and acts as a lightweight batch correction method.

pre-processing options: mitochondrial ge.title: Pre-processing options: Mitochondrial Gene Detection
pre-processing options: mitochondrial ge.description: Pre-processing options for detecting mitochondrial genes

var_name_mitochondrial_genes.help_text: Type: `string`. In which .var slot to store a boolean array corresponding the mitochondrial genes.

obs_name_mitochondrial_fraction.description:
Type: `string`. When specified, write the fraction of counts originating from mitochondrial genes 
(based on --mitochondrial_gene_regex) to an
obs_name_mitochondrial_fraction.help_text:
Type: `string`. When specified, write the fraction of counts originating from mitochondrial genes 
(based on --mitochondrial_gene_regex) to an .obs column with the specified name.
Requires --var_name_mitochondrial_genes.

var_gene_names.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `gene_symbol`. .var column name to be used to detect mitochondrial genes instead of .var_names (default if not set).
Gene names matching with the regex value from --mitochondrial_gene_regex will be identified
as a mitochondrial gene.

mitochondrial_gene_regex.description: Type: `string`, default: `^[mM][tT]-`. Regex string that identifies mitochondrial genes from --var_gene_names
mitochondrial_gene_regex.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `^[mM][tT]-`. Regex string that identifies mitochondrial genes from --var_gene_names.
By default will detect human and mouse mitochondrial genes from a gene symbol.

pre-processing options: qc metrics calcu.title: Pre-processing options: QC metrics calculation options
pre-processing options: qc metrics calcu.description: Pre-processing options for calculating QC metrics

var_qc_metrics.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `ercc,highly_variable`, multiple_sep: `","`. Keys to select a boolean (containing only True or False) column from
var_qc_metrics.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `ercc,highly_variable`, multiple_sep: `","`. Keys to select a boolean (containing only True or False) column from .var.
For each cell, calculate the proportion of total values for genes which are labeled 'True', 
compared to the total sum of the values for all genes. Defaults to the combined values specified for
--var_name_mitochondrial_genes and --highly_variable_features_var_output.

top_n_vars.description: Type: List of `integer`, default: `50,100,200,500`, multiple_sep: `","`. Number of top vars to be used to calculate cumulative proportions
top_n_vars.help_text:
Type: List of `integer`, default: `50,100,200,500`, multiple_sep: `","`. Number of top vars to be used to calculate cumulative proportions.
If not specified, proportions are not calculated. `--top_n_vars 20,50` finds
cumulative proportion to the 20th and 50th most expressed vars.

harmony integration options.title: Harmony integration options
harmony integration options.description: Specifications for harmony integration. Only relevant for annotation method 'harmony_knn'.

theta.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `2`, example: `0:1:2`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Diversity clustering penalty parameter
theta.help_text:
Type: List of `double`, default: `2`, example: `0:1:2`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Diversity clustering penalty parameter. Specify for each variable in group.by.vars. 
theta=0 does not encourage any diversity. Larger values of theta
result in more diverse clusters."

knn label transfer options.title: KNN label transfer options
knn label transfer options.description: Specifications for KNN label transfer. Relevant for annotation methods that perform KNN label transfer (harmony_knn, scanvi_knn, bbknn, scvi_knn, scgpt_integration_knn)

weights.description: Type: `string`, default: `uniform`, choices: ``uniform`, `distance``. Weight function used in prediction
weights.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `uniform`, choices: ``uniform`, `distance``. Weight function used in prediction. Possible values are:
`uniform` (all points in each neighborhood are weighted equally) or 
`distance` (weight points by the inverse of their distance)

n_neighbors.description: Type: `integer`, default: `15`. The number of neighbors to use in k-neighbor graph structure used for fast approximate nearest neighbor search with PyNNDescent
n_neighbors.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `15`. The number of neighbors to use in k-neighbor graph structure used for fast approximate nearest neighbor search with PyNNDescent. 
Larger values will result in more accurate search results at the cost of computation time.

scgpt annotation options.title: scGPT annotation options
scgpt annotation options.description: Specifications for scGPT annotation. Only relevant for annotation method 'scgpt_annotation' or 'scgpt_integration_knn'.

pad_token.description: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. Token used for padding
pad_token.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. Token used for padding.

pad_value.description: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token
pad_value.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token.

n_hvg.description: Type: `integer`, default: `1200`. Number of highly variable genes to subset for
n_hvg.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `1200`. Number of highly variable genes to subset for.

dsbn.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Apply domain-specific batch normalization
dsbn.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Apply domain-specific batch normalization

batch_size.description: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for embedding inference
batch_size.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for embedding inference.

n_input_bins.description: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of bins to discretize the data into; When no value is provided, data won't be binned
n_input_bins.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of bins to discretize the data into; When no value is provided, data won't be binned.

seed.description: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation used for binning
seed.help_text: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation used for binning. If not set, no seed is used.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
